concepts: Operating system manages computer hardware and provides services to applications
Kernel is the core component that handles system calls and resource management
Process management involves creating, scheduling, and terminating processes
Memory management allocates and deallocates memory for running programs
Processes are programs in execution with their own memory space
Threads are lightweight processes sharing memory within same process
CPU scheduling algorithms determine which process runs next
Synchronization mechanisms prevent race conditions in concurrent programs
File systems organize and store data on storage devices
Directory structures provide hierarchical organization of files
File allocation methods include contiguous, linked, and indexed allocation
File permissions control access rights for users and groups
